item.title: liminalismo
item.description:
> en la meua boca un correfoc
Isaac Rodríguez

It's been years since I sat in front of a blank text editor with the intention of typing something that, while not intended exclusively for the public eye, is nonetheless far more out in the open than jotting down my own thoughts in a group chat with myself.

☀️ says I am trapped in a narrative that is also of my own making; I have been mulling it over for months now, and always believed he was right, but it took a 20 minute nap on a rough day to have my mind click into a state that may be the first step in a long (though necessary) journey to recovery.

I can feel myself shifting under the gaze of an audience that mostly exists inside my head, and it reminds me of the times when exposing my vulnerabilities through public venting on Twitter was the only means I had to cope with loss. I'm happy that this time around I am not doing it on a platform that profits off my grief, not gonna lie, and also that the thing that prompted this journal entry, this revamp of the site's files, was eagerness to overcome the grief that has permeated my life for the past 4 years, and gratitude for the unwavering support that helped me believe that a better life was possible.

Imagine a room,
a sudden glow. Here is my hand, my heart,
my throat, my wrist. Here are the illuminated
cities at the center of me, and here is the center
of me, which is a lake, which is a well that we
can drink from, but I can’t go through with it.
I just don’t want to die anymore.

(Richard Siken, "Saying your names")

#journal February 3rd, 2021
